channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3440] The Jon Stewart Clip That Will Make Glenn Beck Cry Real Tear
item.description: Tonight, Jon Stewart opened The Daily Show with what was probably one of his greatest segments ever: a complete and utter destruction of everything Glenn Beck stands for and propagates. And Stewart did it as Beck. Inside, the full segment.

item.title: [+1459] What 200MB looked like in 1970
[+1449] Amazing Paintings.. Umm Wait What?
item.description: Scroll Down till end to see what's inside!

item.title: [+1443] Truck driver pushes car down road at 60mph and doesn't know
item.description: A trucker drives along a motorway at 60mph unaware a car is trapped sideways on his front bumper. The scene was caught on a phone by people in another car.

item.title: [+1363] Sweet Zombie Jesus, A New Futurama Teaser Trailer (VID)
item.description: Good news, everyone! Or as Farnsworth would say, bad news, everyone!

item.title: [+1276] A sobering reminder of our own mortality
[+1025] Court says NO to child porn charges over 'Sexting'
item.description: A Pennsylvania appellate court upheld a preliminary injunction on Wednesday barring local prosecutors from filing felony child porn charges against a teenage girl who took a partially nude photo of herself with her cell phone.

item.title: [+1012] Hot Chip's WTFFFFF Video
item.description: Insane video for their new song 'I Feel Better'. Directed by Peter Serafinowicz.

item.title: [+949] How Grenades Work [Infographic]
item.description: Oh, man. Not only does this infographic show how modern time-delay grenades work, it actually walks you through a bit of the history of the handheld explosive. All while setting a new standard for stick figure abuse!

item.title: [+864] Futurama Return Details Emerge
item.description: The premiere for season 6 – and thus broadcast season 7 – is scheduled for 24 June, 2010

item.title: [+816] A Lot of 30 Rock's Humor is in the Details (PIC)
item.description: The show sometimes seems custom made for HDTV viewers and PVR-pausers.

item.title: [+749] The Unexplainable Gallery
item.description: What? Why? How and WTF?!? are all valid questions you may have while browsing this gallery, questions, that we are unable and or unwilling to answer. A few of these questions however can be answered with the following answer: "Japan"

item.title: [+691] 'South Park' has the most-watched premiere in decade
item.description: The 14th season premiere of Comedy Central's "South Park" was the most watched debut for the show since 1999.

item.title: [+634] WOW! Do Your Crayons Look Like This? (PIC)
item.description: Crayons carved into the 12 symbols of the Chinese zodiac Artist Diem Chau usually works in porcelain, but she sometimes steps it up and uses crayons as her medium. This post has lots of photos showing her carvings of the 12 symbols of the Chinese zodiac. They're on exhibit at the Packer Schopf Gallery in Chicago. My favorite is the rat.

item.title: [+627] The 5 Most Half-Assed Scams That Were Shockingly Successful
item.description: To be a successful con artist, apparently all it takes is some laziness and a stunningly retarded idea.

item.title: [+613] Am I the Only one who Still Prefers Windows XP?
[+585] Smoking guns, dark secrets spilled in YouTube-Viacom filings
item.description: It can't be good news for YouTube's $1 billion copyright infringement lawsuit when plaintiff Viacom unearthed one YouTube founder telling another: "'jawed, please stop putting stolen videos on the site." But YouTube says that Viacom itself paid 18 different marketers to upload material to YouTube... and from Kinko's, no less.

item.title: [+564] How America Became a Surveillance State
item.description: Shane Harris lays out the U.S. government's real-life efforts to see and hear more in the face of growing terrorist threats. He pays particular attention to Total Information Awareness, a post-9/11 research project spearheaded by John Poindexter, once President Reagan's national security advisor.

item.title: [+539] Elderly Couple: Cops Just Won't Stop 'Raiding Our House'
item.description: Police have mistakenly raided their home -----50 TIMES---- looking for crooks. Walter and Rose Martin said the NYPD have always been respectful and never crashed in, but...."I am fearful that if a no-knock warrant is issued with my address that my husband or I will end up having a heart attack," she wrote.

item.title: [+537] It's time for Wall Street to pay
item.description: We need accountability -- as in, jail time where warranted -- for those who created the financial disaster.
